result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy D Bright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy D Bright

records.addlTxt:
State moves to delete the penalty enhancer on count 2.  Motion granted.    
Disorderly conduct - No contest plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in count 1, bail jumping.   Motion granted.   
$100.00 fine, plus costs imposed, total of $579.00, to be paid by 11-16-22 or 12 days jail.   Submit DNA sample.   
Minutes.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:13 p.m.  Defendant, in custody, waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.

Inducement based on today's conversations; to be put in writing to memorialize it.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:   8/26/22, 8:30 a.m.
Minutes.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:07 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy D Bright appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Thomas James appeared by video for Timothy D Bright. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing is set for 07-15-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, repeater, on 06-05-22.
Order to report to TRPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-27-22 at 1:30 pm.  Bail is set at $650.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
